doc:
Franklin Parker https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_Parker 0 Franklin Parker (November 8, 1902 – June 12, 1962), also known as Frank Parker or Franklyn Parker, was an American character actor who appeared in over 100 films during his twenty-five career. Born in Fillmore, Missouri on November 8, 1902, he began his show business career on the vaudeville and Broadway stages, where he proved himself an admirable singer. During those years he would often be billed as Pinky. In his final screen performance, on the small screen's The Donna Reed Show in 1961, he would return to his roots and be credited as Franklin Pinky Parker. His film career would include appearances in such classic films as They Were Expendable, It's a Wonderful Life, Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House, Mighty Joe Young, and Pat and Mike. Occasionally he would have a larger role, such as the lead in the 1935 film, Sweet Surrender. He would die of a heart attack in Hollywood, California on June 12, 1962. Franklin_Parker ( November_8_,_1902 – June_12_,_1962 ) , also_known as Frank_Parker or Franklyn_Parker , was an_American_character_actor who appeared in over_100_films during his_twenty-five_career . Born in Fillmore , Missouri on November_8_,_1902 , he began his_show_business_career on the_vaudeville_and_Broadway_stages , where he proved himself an_admirable_singer . During those_years he would_often_be_billed as Pinky . In his_final_screen_performance , on the_small_screen 's The_Donna_Reed_Show in 1961 , he would_return to his_roots and be_credited as Franklin_Pinky_Parker . His_film_career would_include appearances in such_classic_films as They Were Expendable , It 's a_Wonderful_Life , Mr._Blandings Builds His_Dream_House , Mighty_Joe_Young , and Pat_and_Mike . Occasionally he would_have a_larger_role , such_as the_lead in the_1935_film , Sweet Surrender . He would_die of a_heart_attack in Hollywood , California on June_12_,_1962 .
